website_summaries.verdict: For users who are looking for an affordable easy-to-fly, multi-direction model that is built to withstand most crashes.
pros: Surpasses the rest for all it has to offer, including a rugged build, easy maneuverability, 3-channel remote, brushed motor, and reasonable price
cons: Some reports of defective components and faulty batteries upon arrival

customer_reviews.title: Shocking how quickly it stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely shocked at how many five-star reviews there are here. My son saved up his allowance for a month to buy this, it came in the mail on Friday, he played with it for about an hour before dinner, then after dinner he took it out to fly it again, and in mid-flight it went down and now no longer flies. It still powers on, the rotors still turn, but now it makes a high-pitched grinding sound as if the mechanism is encountering some resistance in rotation, and it does not lift off. Poor kid. A month of patience for less than one evening of playing with this shockingly bad toy.
customer_reviews.author: Lionel Yaceczko

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasts less than 5 min
customer_reviews.text: Two major problems. 1.) Takes an hour to charge for less than 5 minutes of flying time. 2.) Stopped flying after a day of use. Does not lift off. I am not sure why this toy gets such glowing reviews from some. Even if will not break after a day of use. Save up, and purchase a drone. I know the price difference is huge...
customer_reviews.author: Steven Elfant

customer_reviews.title: Battery dead after less than a month
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of these for the kids, both helicopters are flown in the same manner. The first one flies fine and last about 6 minutes, the second one lasts about 3 minutes and the can barely take off. Helicopters are allowed to cool down before they are recharged. Tried contacting Syma directly but they have ignored numerous emails asking what can be done. The reviews are great on this helicopter, perhaps we got a bad one, it's a shame Syma refuses to get back to me. We threw out the box thinking we would not have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly fun. Battery lasts a surprisingly long time considering how light weight the chopper is. The control scheme is totally open loop, so you have to control everything (what I mean is for example the vertical control changes the rotational speed of the rotor, not the height of the chopper). Not recommended for kids due to the control nature (my kids are 8 and 5 and they have no chance). Pretty durable, I've crashed it many times accidentally and it still lives. IR control works just fine indoors. Susceptible to any minor indoor breezes, which makes it tricky in hallways or near doors. Really just surprised how well this thing works for the price,
customer_reviews.author: Dave Burnham

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to fly indoors. If you can work a video game controller, you can work this.
customer_reviews.text: I had a small brookstone helicopter that I had received years ago and that was terrible to fly. This little copter is awesome. Turned it on, brought it up slowly and adjusted the knob so it'd stop slowly spinning one direction and flew it around the office. Lots of fun, short battery life but you can supposedly upgrade it. Still for a couple minutes of fun worth the $20. Spare parts are listed in the manual and very popular on eBay for as low as $1. Their website (Syma) has spare parts for cheap too. Big win since i'll probably break something eventually.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Fun little RC chopper
customer_reviews.text: Get to the chopper!! This little RC helicopter is super fun and super durable. It’s easy to pick up and control out of the box. The charging can be a little confusing but I connected the included usb cord to a cell phone charging plug and it charges just fine. The blades are super flexible, it has taken many collisions with our walls and chairs and no damage or cracks to our home or the helicopter. My 11 and 4 year old love it and I love pestering the wife with it. A fantastic buy! Also I’d suggest buy the replacement parts kit in case of any unforeseen damages.
customer_reviews.author: Syssaq

customer_reviews.title: 1 out of 2 works correctly
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of these. One flies perfectly; this one will not hover. The trim is set correctly but it seems as though the balance is off as it starts flying ok and then makes right circles that get larger and larger until it hits the wall and crashes. Our green one has zero control. Even if you have it resting on the hardwood floor and crank the propellers up to low, it moves to the direct right. Something isn't right with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy J

customer_reviews.title: Bad drift and hard to control
customer_reviews.text: (Review by wife) I bought this for our youngest son (7 years old) because he wanted a helicopter so badly. Unfortunately, this one wasn't a very good one and we got what we paid for. The drift was bad and it didn't stay still and steady at all. The control was rather touchy and it often veered off in a random direction. Would not recommend. Will be trying the JJRC H42WH Butterfly Mini RC Quadcopter (with camera) for his birthday this year.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Martin

customer_reviews.title: Helicopter Will Not Take-Off
customer_reviews.text: If you look on Google, a lot of customers have had the same problems we have had. This helicopter just doesn't have the power to take off. It will basically only race along the ground. We got this as a present for my son and he was not able to fly it. Because we ordered it so far ahead of time, we were not able to return it. It really is a shame since he was so excited to get this for his birthday. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: sleepinghalo

customer_reviews.title: Survives crashes - DURABLE AND FUN
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy helicopter that SURVIVES CRASHES ! I can't tell you the number of remote control items I've bought that didn't survive a single crash. This one takes a licking and keeps on ticking (flying too). Battery life is fair for the size and weight of the item. Radio control unit I would say is the weak point. The flight controls are not intuitive (the left/right rudder seem backwards to me) and the range is MAX 10ft. This heli can't be used outdoors for much as it gets blown away by the slightest wind and out of the controllers range. It is an indoor helicopter but fun as heck and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Great helicopter not only for beginners but also for someone used to RC who just wants to fly this around the house not worrying about breaking anything expensive. I sit on my couch and fly this thing all over. So much fun. I’m sure kids would enjoy it too but I’ve yet to share it lol. It has fallen from great heights and still is good as new. Remote works off IR so needs line of sight and don’t dare fly this little thing outside because the wind will pick it up like nothing and also the receiver will pick up IR interference.
customer_reviews.author: A. A

customer_reviews.title: Really fun helicopter for the price
customer_reviews.text: This helicopter is great when you consider the price. It charges quickly. The steering controls are very sensitive, and it moves well. A kid can fly the helicopter, but it will take some practice for a younger child to get comfortable with the controls. There are some minor issues with the product. It only lasts about 6-7 minutes on a charge, which means you have to charge it pretty often. It does not work well outside if there is any wind. Even with those issues, it is definitely worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: dhoped123

customer_reviews.title: So much fun. crashed 10 + times learning to fly (and not to panic) still works awesome  !  !
customer_reviews.text: Best $19.99 I've ever spent. This helicopter is so much fun. I just wish I could fly it longer between charging. I understand there is a bigger battery for this helicopter but I also understand that people are having nothing but problems with a bigger, heavier battery. I have a 15 foot by 16 foot room with a 10 foot ceiling to fly in and after 3 flights, I can keep the helicopter flying around the room in tight circles, straight, up and down for the batteries entire charge without crashing. This is a must buy. Just don't panic on the controls and "over correct" like me and you will be fine ! Dan
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Best little Heli
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second one within one week, this is so unbelievably amazing product and works extremely well. It has a solid feel. The expensive versions cost at least 5 to 10 times and feel flimsy. At first I thought the small tail prop was not working but it only works when going forward or backwards to do not think it is a defective heli. You will not regret buying this. The time it flies is nice and long charging cable lights p when it is filled. Kids love flying this. Will not regret buying this. If this was a 4 channel it would be even better. Syma should make a 4 one too.
customer_reviews.author: Dabba

customer_reviews.title: kind of crappy
customer_reviews.text: it's hard to control. it hasn't held my husband's interest. Be sure you have a nice large unobstructed space with no air current interference and preferably a carpet...since you'll see it crashes a lot especially as you are learning. I tried it and I find it unwieldy but I'm going to try again outside since I wasn't properly set up indoors before. I was also annoyed, it was actually priced as low as $9.99 but price had gone up to $16. that's fine but it's really not a very high quality product. Flip side my nephew loves his. My brother bought one and recommended this product. And, so there are happy customers out there I know...
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, especially for less than 20 bucks. They can handle some pretty hard crashes too, but don’t expect them to last forever if you keep crashing them. Not enough power to use outside, it’s best indoors. I wish you could buy JUST the helicopter and save a few dollars. I’ve had 3 of these over the years, so I’ve got 3 of the controllers laying around. Don’t need any more of those, just want new helicopters when I break one.
customer_reviews.author: TLP

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price - somewhat steep learning curve - not for children
customer_reviews.text: My first drone, copter, whatever. Surprisingly durable for the price. I underestimated how steep the learning curve is. The up/down stick on the remote is very sensitive and takes precision to get it stable. You'll need hands like a surgeon. Though, of course YMMV. It's taken some beatings too and keeps on ticking. I wouldn't trust it with children. The blades have hit my hands while grabbing it in mid flight. It did not hurt or draw blood, however if getting hit in the face, I would act differently. You can even dissemble these and get parts to repair them, though for $20 I'm not sure it's worth it.

customer_reviews.title: Flawed design
customer_reviews.text: The rear propellor is supposed to activate to lift the tail so the helicopter can fly forward. The motor isn’t powerful enough to lift the tail leaving the helicopter with only up and down and rotational controls. The controller uses infrared line of sight to control the helicopter which leaves you guessing if it’ll respond as it flies away because it can’t be flown forward. Finally, the tail broke after just a few flights. This product is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great fun while it lasts
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as one of the gifts for my 5 year old son's birthday. It is a major hit. Even with my husband. It takes a little practice in learning how to control/maneuver the helicopter but it's really great for the price point. The only two drawbacks are it can't "hover" in place. It's constantly moving in a forward or backward direction and the charge DOES NOT LAST LONG AT ALL. The longest he has been able to fly the 'copter after fully charging is about 15 minutes. Just when he is getting into to it, it's time to plug it back up which is the only bummer.
customer_reviews.author: T. Durham

customer_reviews.title: Fun too fly, easy to operate, chinsy, cheap, broke quickly.
customer_reviews.text: These are fun but only last about 5-10 minutes in the air before needing to be charged. Wont work well even with the slightest wind, and is best used indoors with high ceilings. It tends to get hairs twisted into the propellers and they aren't easily removed. After about a month it broke, but it's still flyable. At this price range I'm not surprised it's broke so quickly. you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Bones McLure

customer_reviews.title: Horrifying Junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought on prime day for sons birthday. He was so disappointed when the chopper would just fall out of the sky. Despite trying several brands of quality batteries, the remote will lose signal mid flight and the chopper just dies and crashes. I felt horrible and bummed, but amazon made it right by sending a replacement. Unfortunately the same thing occurred with the new chopper despite trying different combos of chopper and remote to rule out a defective unit. Do not buy at any price!
customer_reviews.author: B-lo

customer_reviews.title: Beware of False Advertisement!
customer_reviews.text: This item is advertised as Syma S107G (color white and gold) , and you even see pictures of S107G printed on the body of the helicopter. However, what we got was a plain white and black S107, even though the box says it's a S107G model. Very disappointed, as I had spent much time on Amazon searching for S107G model for my kids, and thought that I had finally found it. Returning this item back to Amazon, and will be ordering an authentic one from Syma directly.
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: Best money spent in a long time!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure you could have so much fun for such a relatively low price anywhere else. These little rc helicopters are really well built and are super simple to control. I got one for my 5 year old who had completely mastered it. I had so much fun playing with his toy that I got a second one for me to play with as well! If you are hear reading these reviews, just go ahead and buy it, it is that good!
customer_reviews.author: GunnyKnowsBest

customer_reviews.title: Best Helicopter I’ve Ever Bought!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought my 4 year old COUNTLESS remote control helicopters and drones, and this one is the best so far, hands down! I expected it to be another crappy one because of the price, but he picked it out and it was so cheap I went ahead and ordered it. The maneuverability on this thing is so easy, we are impressed! I’d take a video but it’s hard to fly it and record myself at the same time lol.
customer_reviews.author: Kileah A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little chopper, good for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these in the mall when I was growing up and I remember trying up legos to it and flying around, it's a good little helicopter for indoors. The only complaint is it doesnt hover really well. It turns left or right by itself even after fine tuning the remote. I know it's a cheap toy so I cant complain. You can also use it as a fan on a hot day, it pushes a lot of air lol
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Technical issue
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item twice. The first one worked awesome for about 4 days. Then the helicopter and remote stopped communicating unless the helicopter was charging. That defeats the purpose. However, I chose to get a replacement figuring it was a one off. the second one arrives, and even with new batteries the remote won't power up. Needless to say, this one is going back as well. I rarely write reviews, but this has been beyond frustrating. My 11 year old doesn't even want to try a new one and that's very odd!!!
customer_reviews.author: Not sorry

customer_reviews.title: Charging cable doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas and the charging cable has never worked correctly, where it plugs into the port on the helicopter it's loose and never makes a solid connection. My Father-in-Law ordered 3 of them and only one charging cable worked for all 3 had same issue, wouldn't make a solid connection to charge the toy. It's great fun and very entertaining. If the company sends me another one or fixes the issue. I will change my rating. I don't recommend this item find a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EASY for Beginners - Fun to Fly
customer_reviews.text: These little helicopters can take a crash and keep going. They are easy to fly and a lot of fun indoors! My 8 year old granddaughter loves to fly our collection of these SYMA S107 and S107G helis. We have 3 of them. Our granddaughter reports that they are easier to fly than the quadcopter she got for Christmas. Just remember, these are infrared so they don't work outside. They are perfect for those days when the weather is lousy, or it's just too hot to be outside. These helicopters are a good deal for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift, resilient
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas gift for my girlfriend's 7 year old. Even though the recommended age is 14, he loves this thing. He is able to fly it around without difficulty and is always asking to use it. You get about 10 minutes of flight time per hour charge. This thing has spent a week being bounced off the ceiling, floor, all 4 walls, and everything else in the house and is still going strong. I imagine it will break eventually, but I already feel like I got my $20 worth and it appears that replacement parts are inexpensive. I am probably going to buy another one for my office.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Disposable Helicopter Toy with a 1-3 month lifespan
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 3 of these. We returned the first one as it was defective out of the box. The second one flew for a while and then the gears gave up. The third one is still flying after 3 months but I doubt it will last 6 months. Also, beware of the warranty by Asurion - based on the review there, it is difficult to file a claim and it takes forever to receive payment if you receive it at all. The kids had fun while they lasted but they didn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Little Heli, Big Fun
customer_reviews.text: Hard to have more RC fun for less dollars than an S107G Looks cool, and pretty easy to fly You will break parts... Replacement parts are cheap - sometimes you are best off ordering from overseas if you aren't in a rush and want the best deals. Keep your mods simple, and you can really build a sweet rig, extra battery mods are most popular and require minimal soldering skills. As far as I can tell, all new stock S107G have the throttle spring 'mod' right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Ferf

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun but does not last long
customer_reviews.text: Pros: great price point Durable can handle crashes Fun to use Cons: does not hold a charge for very long Very sensitive controls may be hard for younger consumers. ____________ The above review was written shortly after receiving the product. I bought three of these for people at Christmas time. As of today January 31, two are broken. The helicopter can take the crashes easily, it is the on/ off button and the charging plug that do not hold up. Two of the helicopters on/ off switch broke off, on of those two couldn't hold a charge do to the connection to the copter itself.
customer_reviews.author: barcamv

customer_reviews.title: Best helicopter for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: This little thing flies very well. The battery last 15-20 minutes of constant flying. It is amazingly easy to learn to control. Within minutes I was flying it around the room and landing it on a book on the coffee table. It is also very durable, it has crash landed several times and still looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Schuteker

customer_reviews.title: After a year, we're still flying this around and it's fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Once you learn how to use it with the remote, this helicopter is great and long lasting. Crashing doesn't seem to damage it. Has flashing lights when it flies. It takes practice to fly it, but once you get the hang of the remote you can fly it fast or slow, low or high. It's too light weight to be flown outdoors. Lots of fun and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Especially great for the beginner
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful, especially indoors. They don't have the speed to compete with the breeze of the outdoors and the sunlight can jam the signal, causing erratic behavior. But indoors it rocks! It's absolutely controllable and stable indoors. It's also sturdy enough to survive multiple collisions. This will be my 4th S107 (they don't make good chew toys for boxers). My daughter and I have a blast with ours. They excel for beginners as they are forgiving and easily mastered, but they're great for those who aren't new to RC helicopters as well. Just not ideal for outdoors except for still nights.
customer_reviews.author: D. EllisTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: I love my new red flyer because it flies perfectly straight
customer_reviews.text: I love my new red flyer because it flies perfectly straight. This is a hall of fame toy and the most fun you can have for less that 20 bucks:) It takes some care to keep these helicopters running but if you're careful with them, they will give you many hours of flying fun. This is the best entry level drone because it's easiest to fly 3 channels indoor. Once you master a 3 channel indoor heli, you can try your luck at a 4 channel quad. Walk before you fly, or fly indoors before you fly outdoors:)
customer_reviews.author: RC Beach Flyer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three of these and two out of the three have stopped working within 48 hours of use which equates to about 10 flights. One of the units just fails to turn either of the rotors even though the battery is charged and the unit is powered on. With the second one, the lower blade stopped turning properly so it never lifts off. This is after I double checked that the gears were all in contact with each other and connected properly. When they do work, they work great! Very stable and easy to fly.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hayes

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this helicopter!
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised by how well this gadget works, for the price. My son is only 5 years old and he can maneuver the helicopter (with a little help from dad). It gives him so much joy. It works best indoors or outdoors when there is ZERO wind. A little wind can knock the helicopter out of bounds and it causes the helicopter to lose signal from the remote. Definitely get it. I will be getting more of this for future Christmas gifts for others!
customer_reviews.author: Pop Chips

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be easy to operate? The controls didn't even work. You couldn't even set the frequency/channel like you're supposed to. The instructions were written in broken English and barely tell you anything. I bought two of these and neither one worker. Buyer beware. This ended up being a wasted of $40 for my kids' Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: Coaxial's are fun but they are limiting 5+ years later I have ...
customer_reviews.text: For people that are interested in reviews of products several years after purchase please see my experience below: Previous years product was purchased: 6+ Years Shipping: As expected Amazon handling: As expected Review: I bought this item to get in to the RC Heli scene. Coaxial's are fun but they are limiting 5+ years later I have replaced a few parts and the thing probably would fly, but I just keep it around for a timeline kind of thing on my hobby. I would purchase again if someone wanted to try and learn how to fly.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: So Fun! Easy to Fly and Control! Awesome gift!!
customer_reviews.text: This works so well! My son bought it with his own money and I warned him it probably wouldn’t work since it was so cheap for a remote control helicopter BUT boy was I wrong. It works great. So fun to use at night with the lights on it and very durable. It survived flying into a wall and a dog trying to get it out of the sky! Super easy to control. Highly recommend for a first remote helicopter!!
customer_reviews.author: Shell

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable flyer that would last more than a couple of weeks. We had some family that was still using this after a year (it was a girl who took good care of her toys). I've been pleased with how it flies compared to AirHog brand and feel like it will last longer too. It came with one replacement blade.
customer_reviews.author: Flyin'A Farm

customer_reviews.title: No way to fly 2 of these helis at the same time using respective remote because each remote will control both at the same time
customer_reviews.text: Nice toy for the price. However, there is a defect in the helicopter in that if you buy two of these and try to fly each one using their respective remote controller, each remote will control both of the helicopters at the same time, because although the remote controllers have a button to change the remote's frequency, the helicopters DO NOT have a way to change their frequency as you can with the remotes. So beware. As a side note, this heli is the same model as the Cheerwing S107/S107G Phantom 3CH 3.5 Channel Mini RC Helicopter with Gyro Blue.
customer_reviews.author: Y. I.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for 11 year old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson's 11th birthday, and he was estatic! He asked for an r/chelicopter for his birthday, and this one was a prime recommendation, so I figured I'd try it for the price. His exact word was "awesome". It was small enough, and had enough controls on it so that he could use in the house as well as outside. It took 6 AA batteries, which while quite a bit, isn't enough to weigh the copter down. ;) It does many tricks, yet is not too difficult for him to lose his interest whie trying to earn it. It was a perfect choice.
customer_reviews.author: SuperShopperSuzanne

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Fun for Adults
customer_reviews.text: I thought I got a dud when I got mine. It would lift up and down and wondered why the rear rotor wasn't spinning at all. It only spins when it move forward or moves backward. 30 minute to charge and flight time is about ten minutes. You don't really pay attention to time when you are operating it. I got around mine by purchasing two of these since they don't cost that much. On and off switch on the side. Blinking lights when switched on. Just watch out for pets since they get close with curiosity.
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: This is a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed learning how to fly it at the office. Time to take it home and mess with the cats... Pros: $20, appears to be tough (I've wrecked it MANY times), if you crash, often a quick blip on the gas will right the thing wherever landed and you can take off again. Also easy to learn and there is a way to adjust the trim so it doesn't spin. Cons: Slow (to me) recharge time, you have to remember to point the controller at the helicopter, and rarely the power dies and and your bird drops like a stone. Wind from ceiling fans and air conditioner will affect it.
customer_reviews.author: Scirocco333

customer_reviews.title: Fun indoor helicopter for kids and adults!
customer_reviews.text: Ok let's start with I bought my first one over a year ago and it still works great. Now both of my children and my nephew have one each. They are 8,6,5 years old. My oldest is really good with his, the younger two have lots of crashes. These are for the indoors but my kids have used theirs outside. Must be no wind. Great product responds very well and lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Withers

customer_reviews.title: Great price.  Didn't leave the ground.
customer_reviews.text: Opened it. Fully charged it. With the rotor throttle all the way "up" to max power the rotors power up and they do not provide enough lift to level the ground. This was in an area free of drafts or air currents. It would maneuver an turn it just never left the ground. Contacted seller to return/replace and seller wanted me to upload video and jump through a bunch of hoops and they would refund. A lot of back and forth and they refunded. I imagine I either got a lemon or fake syma. It looked real but would not provide enough lift to leave the ground.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Thin Silver Bar BROKE on 2 different helicopters
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 helicopters, red and blue. The red helicopter broke on the first day. The thin silver bar connecting the body to the back, broke. The package was thrown away, so I couldn't return. The blue helicopter, thin silver bar, broke 3 weeks later. Same thin silver bar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend is getting a surgery where he will not be able to stand or walk for 6 weeks, and he wanted some "toys" and gadgets to keep him entertained so I got this for him for christmas. He loves this thing. Super easy to fly and it somehow hasn't broken with how many times he has wrecked it (and the cats think its fun to knock it down). It does require 6 AA batteries that aren't included which I hadn't read beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Carson Berglund

customer_reviews.title: Defective product (Twice)
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this product twice. The first one's remote control was not working at all. Thus, I have requested a replacement. The kids were so excited to have it. The second one was working well at the beginning. However; when I tried to charge it, the charger was not working. I decided to return the item
customer_reviews.author: Amine Merve Unan

customer_reviews.title: Nice indoor only chopper
customer_reviews.text: Nice little indoor helicopter. Takes about 45 minutes to charge and runs about 7-8 minutes. Easy to fly indoors but cannot fly if the wind is over 3mph (this includes under fast ceiling fans). Check out my video and let me know if you have any questions about it. Thanks! Purchase:
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: It won't work or even charge 😕
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work. Just received it today and I put it on the charger it blinked red and stopped. I assumed it was full. Tried using and it won't go. Then I turned both off then on brand new batteries. And still won't go. My son and nephew were excited and left disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly awesome!
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to find a good review of remote control helicopters... this one seemed to have more positive reviews... and now is we why. My six year old can use it with ease. It has crashed quite a few times but has been resilient/held up. I love the way it charges (wire folds up inside so it doesn’t get lost and my little boy can do it by himself) Nice fly life for price. His favorite toy for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy,  nice remote control, USB charging or by remote control
customer_reviews.text: For ~20$ surprisingly good , remote has more detail than expected, torque/trim adjustment, right stick is 4 way for spin right left and tilt forward/backwards with fan on the tail which is variable speed for both vs on off . The left stick not spring loaded for the throttle making it stay at certain height easy. Tons of fun have to be kinda careful with it , seems the small plastic parts that hold the stabilizer will snap if the crash is decent enough. But so far so good with some minor crashes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple easy to fly
customer_reviews.text: I've had this model in the past and they work great and take a beating. very easy instructions to operate even a teenager could operate it. Can really only use it in the house as outdoor the wind really bothers it. Great value if purchased off of Amazon and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Ritch Vernon

customer_reviews.title: fun enough
customer_reviews.text: i've had other, similar helicopters before and this one is definitely more erratic than the others. Maybe the one i got has a flaky control because it will, occasionally apply a bunch of power even though i'm not touching the throttle. Also the tail rotor is under powered so moving forward and backward is sluggish and unresponsive. that said it does hover easily, is pretty rugged and the rotational trim works well.
customer_reviews.author: toddler1138

customer_reviews.title: Great price for what you get
customer_reviews.text: Great price for what you get. It is a very fun toy, the frame is durable and the moving parts too, I have crashed it at least 15 times and still flies great. It is small so beware of fans running or A/C vents blowing because you most likely lose control. I cannot fly it outside, it is not heavy enough to stand the slightest breeze and the remote is infrared so sun light interferes with the operation. The battery lasts 7-9 minutes flying and 35-40 charging. I bought another one so I can fly longer. Great for learning If this review was helpful to you click Helpful so others can see it too.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy!
customer_reviews.text: Shipped fast. A lot of fun to see it flying. Very good quality for the price. My only advice: be careful when landing, it is obviously a delicate toy. Brought it for a gift-swap and ended up being a great gift under $20. I like the fact that it included the remote control so you don't have to download apps on your cellphone. Batteries were included for the helicopter but not for the remote (needed 6 aa) luckily we had some at home. Other than that makes a great and cool gift. I almost wished I had bought one for me!
customer_reviews.author: Chema

customer_reviews.title: HAS A RANGE OF ABOUT TEN FEET
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a number of this kind of helicopter. This one has a very short range. About ten feet. Then control totally goes away. It just dies. Maybe I got a bad one. Unfortunately, I bought it in October and saved it for Christmas, so the return window has closed. Because of the short range, I couldn't really put it through its paces, so I won't comment on handling characteristics.
customer_reviews.author: Honest American Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift and toy to play with!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a Christmas gift last year and I gotta say, it was worth it. I'm not too familiar with RC types of stuff but on a beginner stand point looking at something to just enjoy. I gotta say, this thing was great to play with. It was definitely easy to learn to use, and within a few minutes of receiving the gift, he was flying this thing all around the house! He definitely loves using this to play with the dogs too, they always bark and try to catch it when they see or hear this thing flying around. Over half a year later, he was still playing with this helicopter and he still likes it!
customer_reviews.author: G.P.

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to learn to fly, but a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is about the most fun you can have for $20. Tough to get the hang of the controls, but once you do it's a kick. Charges off a USB port, flies for about 15 minutes? My boy loves to watch me fly it all over the living room. Good time to bond with him.
customer_reviews.author: Janel A.

customer_reviews.title: Crazy fun
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow! I ordered this for my 5 year old son. Well this thing is crazy! Maybe too much for his age, but he can operate it. And it is actually a lot of fun and once you try it out a couple of times you can get the hang of it. I haven't owned anything like this before so it was a little overwhelming/scary at first. The blades spin super fast! It will hover without manipulating the remote control, my 5 year old son figured that out. We have only played with it inside, because I think if you have any wind, it is really light, it would be gone. But it is amazing and soooo much fun!
customer_reviews.author: BecT

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a birthday gift for my cousin who turned 7. He loved it! It’s a great value for $20, and the presentation is fantastic. I didn’t even have to wrap it because the box itself looked very nice, and it has a handle on it for easy carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Bought two for me and the kids to have fun with inside
customer_reviews.text: The helicopter flies good inside. My eight year old loves it. Something fun to do in the garage or in the house during the covid-19 stay-at-home orders. I only gave it three stars because I bought two of them and one of them is having a battery issue where it doesn't fully charged and doesn't fly as high as long as the other one...
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Helicopter become uncontrollable even at distance that larger than 3ft. Unusable (((
customer_reviews.text: I dont believe how its possible that this item received so many good reviews. Its just crap Unfortunately the remote is so bad that the Heli become uncontrollable (and fall immediately) when the distance reach some 2-3ft. It works only when i really close to it - Holding the item in one hand and remote at other.... Unbelievable ((( The remote is just unusable , and i have nothing to do with that... Moreover , i tried to contact the seller and after 4 days havent received any response Awful experience and waste of money. Beware
customer_reviews.author: StephB

customer_reviews.title: but with the constant bickering over who gets to fly it makes it seem like it lasts an hour
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a christmas present for my 5 year old daughter. She loves it. As does my husband. They constantly argue over who gets to use the remote first. Unlike many of the things I've read in the question area, we have had success using this helicopter outdoors. Haven't paid much attention to the amount of sunlight/cloud coverage, or what the wind/breeze may be, but so far, hasn't been an issue. But OMG, do not let the blades hit you. The battery life is about 8 minutes of fly time, but with the constant bickering over who gets to fly it makes it seem like it lasts an hour.
customer_reviews.author: VICTORY

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, hard to get parts.
customer_reviews.text: Great little basic helicopter. Controls are very simple and it performs well. Keep in mind this is a basic little helicopter. This is great for indoors, outdoors not so much. Very sensitive to wind amd doesnt have a very long range. Only downside is finding parts. I have crashed it several times and the replacment part needed are not really available or easy to find. But considering the price its not so bad. If parts were available would give 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Pathfinders

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Helicopter - Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is a Great indoor helicopter. Amazon price is Great. Its Great Fun and Entertainment for the whole family. Heli's Stability is amazing which makes anyone can fly this. My 3 yr old just getting a hang of it. One issue with the Battery is the Charging time increases as time goes by, When the helicopter is new, it got charged in approx 20 mins, after 6-9 months, it almost took 40-60 mins to charge the battery. I wish it had detachable Lipo battery capability which I can buy in bulk and charge them for non-stop fun. These Heli's are cheap so I would buy 2 and charge one while the kids play with other. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: iPPK

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the remote`
customer_reviews.text: Very fun andt easy to use. Just make sure to go easy when pressing the remote stick for lift off. It goes from 0 to 100 real quick and youll hit the ceiling. Other than that, its so much fun. The kids and adults were playing with it
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best $20 I ever spent for my 5 year old. We've had more expensive helicopters that didnt even come close to taking the abuse this thing has!!!! Its lasted a month now after numerous bangs and crashes!!! Will be buying again when the first one breaks!!! Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Poor Range and Flight Time
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This little 'copter is well built. It's a shame that's all that's good about it. Cons: Very very short flight time. The distance you can fly it from the the transmitter is about 15'. After that it loses connection and literally shuts off and drops to the ground. The left stick is throttle only - no rudder, so your control is limited making it unnecessarily hard to fly. I do not recommend this copter. Spend a little more for a quality beginner copter is my advice. Blade brand is good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice starter Heli
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fly. Great for someone wanting to dabble in the hobby. Only a 3 channel so it very easy to fly. Very durable it can handle many crashes. For the price it can’t be beat. Keep in mind it’s only a three channel so you don’t have the sideways maneuvering. I have purchased four of them two for myself and two for friends
customer_reviews.author: Neff

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t take off at all even on full charge
customer_reviews.text: My son was totally excited on seeing this delivered. However the first impression was disappointing, it didn’t take off, so we decided to recharge it for an hour, charging was complete but still the same. Then I left it to charge the whole night, still the same, feel silly, now I need to buy him a new product from local store for his Birthday gift that never worked. Buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Lot's of fun for $20
customer_reviews.text: These are a ton of fun for $20. They are easy to fly and the batteries charge pretty fast with modern chargers. My 6 year old can fly them, although he's crashed his several times and broken a few pieces. My 8 year old can fly his and hasn't broken anything yet. They only have two channels, so you can only fly two at a time. Still fun though.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua_D

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Wanted one for a few years. After looking around at a lot of different options, this one stood out on top for almost all minicopters. I love this thing. It's intuitive and quite easy to fly. Very durable, I have wrecked it quite a few times and the only thing showing any wear are the blades but that's expected. I even submerged it in water accidently when the switch was off and it works perfectly after being dried out. This chopper can be a little unstable and hates the sun but for the price that's not really even an issue. Would recommend to anyone for any reason: gift, novelty, hobbies, ect.
customer_reviews.author: Franz

customer_reviews.title: Crushed my son’s spirits
customer_reviews.text: The best thing ever was seeing my child open this and his delight at flying it. But 20 minutes later when it didn’t work at all, the disappointment was crushing. I got a warranty on it & don’t even know if I want to use it, as I don’t want my sweet little guy to be so crushed a second time.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This product was just ok. I’m glad I didn’t pay anymore for it because it broke after the third use. We did have fun playing with it while it lasted. It was easy to learn how to use and good for beginners!
customer_reviews.author: Taija

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for indoors
customer_reviews.text: It is the not the best helicopter that I own, but it is still good. It isn't good outside because the it follows the wind. And there is always wind outside, so I recommend you to use it indoors. Pros: :) Easy to learn The battery 🔋lasts for 25-30 minutes Can survive any crash Cons: :( Very sharp blades/propellers, if a person gets hit, it WILL HURT When outdoors, only follows the wind Otherwise, this a pretty good plane and recommend it for starters And the price is good. Only 20$.
customer_reviews.author: Hailey

customer_reviews.title: Mine is junk
customer_reviews.text: Won't fly stable at all. Goes from barely hovering off the ground to bouncing off the ceiling with no rhyme or reason as to why. Pulls every which way without using the direction controls. Wing broke off after a few dings. Maybe I got a bad one. I thought I just didn't know what I was doing but after reading reviews and watching videos I can see that mine didn't work right. This is a lot to write about a 20$ item. It's barely worth the trouble to return.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Higbee

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, one issue ...
customer_reviews.text: I will only give it 4 stars for one single reason: purchased 3 of them and all 3 failed with same exact problem, the tiny little piece that connects the tail props with the body of the helicopter broke within one week. None of the repair kits available on Amazon contain those so I had to order a bunch oversees and takes forever to arrive (in meanwhile I used some scotch tape). Other than that it’s a great toy, perfect for indoor use and drives my Yorkee craaaazy :-)
customer_reviews.author: Crina

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 4 year old grandson a year and a half ago. It has been crashed against the ceiling in his living room many, many times. It has been crashed against the floor numerous times. Despite this beating it still works and flies. This product is amazing in its quality. After all of this time it is still my grandsons favorite toy!! I highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!  Beginner toy helicopter.
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected, easy and fun to use indoors. Parts are available cheap, but it's probably better to buy another when you eventually break it. If you don't crash it, it could last a long time, IMO. Heli battery is rechargeable and gives 7-9 minutes of flying. Controller needs 6 AA batteries, so I use eneloops for it. Fun to fly it around the house cats. Pros: price, quality, ease of use, size, relatively quiet, fun, rechargeable heli battery. Cons: none, what more could you want for 15 dollars?!
customer_reviews.author: BubbaChive207

customer_reviews.title: and was fun. It eventually did break and quit
customer_reviews.text: This WAS the second one l owned. The first one would not break or die. It lasted for quite some time, and was fun. It eventually did break and quit. As for the second one, which has been sent back......well about a week in the helicopter would not go more than about 7-10' without losing signal with the transmitter. For the price point the first one was great, hence buying a second, but it just did not compare.....Sure is a bummer because they are fun.
customer_reviews.author: Haveablast

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Got this an a gift for an awesome 11 year old boy. He said, "Easy controls and no problems with the helicopter itself. The blades are so soft so its like a spy helicopter. It's easy to control". It should be noted that he's had a little prior experience with this type of toy.
customer_reviews.author: Hibiscus

customer_reviews.title: So very worth the mere $20
customer_reviews.text: I still cannot believe that I can buy this for under $20 delivered to my house. Picked it up for a grab bag and it everyone was stealing it from the person who had it before them. Ended up purchasing another for my nephew and we loved playing with it. You must use this indoors, or on days with no wind. Its super light weight and wind will make difficult to control. Battery doesn't last too long... but still, tons of fun for $20
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to fly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy for my daughter to play with after we received a rather cheap version as a gift. This is quite a good quality toy and for $20, amazing. It's easy to figure out, easy to fly and can take quite a whack from an inexperienced pilot. The only negative I can see is the long charging time, about an hour, and short flying time, about six minutes. If this is a concern, buy two.
customer_reviews.author: EastMemphis

customer_reviews.title: These are a lot of fun, got one that is a little sensitive this time though
customer_reviews.text: We have bought Syma copters in the past and they worked great. This one is pretty hard to control, which is unusual for these Syma copters in my experience. I think the one we received is just very sensitive for some reason. Guess we just got lucky this time. In general, these Syma copters are a TON nocer than others out there. We tried an ir Hogs copter once, and that thing was a piece of trash compared tot he Syma. Despite this one being a little hard to control, I don't think it is typical of these copters and I would buy a Syma copter again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Cool Helicopter
customer_reviews.text: This helicopter is a pretty cool. It is easy to learn to fly. It flies for about 7-8 minutes of flying. It flies pretty high and you are able to hover. We have used inside our two story home and outside. When we used it outside it was windy and didn't do well with the wind. It is also cool to fly in the dark with the bright lights.
customer_reviews.author: Fun Mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little 'copter
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little 'copter. After fully charged, it holds the charge longer than I anticipated - and that applies for both use and storage. I played with it for 30-minutes (the expected charge life was around 40-minutes) and then stored it back in its box. I then took it out of the box two days later and played with it another 10-minutes and it still worked fine. I'm fairly certain the next time I play with it, the batteries will need to be recharged soon after playing with it. Also, the blades are made of stiff plastic that have pivot points allowing them to hit something without breaking. And the little blinking lights add a really FUN element. Fun all around!
customer_reviews.author: KU Alumnus

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Used to have a bunch of these from target about 5 years ago. They run NOTHING like they used to. Returning ASAP. Controller is either full throttle or nothing just like the other real reviews on here. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: JDUB74

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Hover
customer_reviews.text: This copter flies very nice and is very stable. The nice thing about this copter is the remote control throttle. The throttle doesn't have a spring on it so you can set the level and virtually fly it hands free, with minimal adjustments. I have other copters very similar to this one but the throttle has a spring on them. With those copters you have to keep constant and even pressure on the throttleto hover. My 8 year old grandson can fly this one with no problems. In fact he has gotten pretty good at it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great Company! Helicopter broke.
customer_reviews.text: The helicopter worked great for 2 week and then died. We requested a refund, which the company honored, and we received the credit back 2 hrs after UPS picked it up. Sad about the copter, impressed with the company.
customer_reviews.author: MrBubble

customer_reviews.title: The Best Cheap Toy Value Ever
customer_reviews.text: I have crashed this thing a hundred times into walls tables and even my wife with no damage to the copter or my wife. I am over 50 and this thing is the most fun I've had for under 20 bucks. I've had it for only a couple of weeks and I crash it uh I mean fly it, daily. If it breaks tomorrow I still think It is a hundred times better than any electrical toy in its price range.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Very basic functions
customer_reviews.text: This may be OK for a beginner, but having flown RC heli's in the past, the limited amount of control you have over this makes it hard to get used to. It goes forward and back, rotates right and left, so you are left trying to maneuver with the 2 axis'. Looks great and appears to be very well built.
customer_reviews.author: cliff vanderpool

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK OUTSIDE
customer_reviews.text: Dont be fooled by this thing when it came I read the manual because it didnt work and it says you can't fly it outside because sun messes with it. This is confirmed true. So unless I want my 7 year old daughter flying it into my flat screen tv its junk
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of my absolute favorite toys as an adult
customer_reviews.text: One of my absolute favorite toys as an adult. I flew this thing around our den constantly for months. I would charge it, fly for as long as I could, then recharge and repeat. At one point, I had three. They fly steady, are easily maneuverable, reasonably durable, and cheap. Crashes happen, and I rarely chipped a blade unless I was being reckless. Steer clear of pet water bowls, fish tanks, and other humans (really dangerous around long hair) and you'll have a great toy that will last at least six months with heavy usage. Pet and human hair can wrap around the rotor, so keep it clean. Overall, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Grill

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun for Adults and Kids!
customer_reviews.text: I am a little older than 10 and have been having a lot of fun with this Helicopter since I received it yesterday! It is amazingly durable. I have bounced it off of ceilings and walls without any permanent damage! Learning to fly this is a bit challenging. Once you have mastered vertical flight, then you can work on going forward and backward, and turning left and right. The port on the helicopter for charging is a little small and the instructions are not written in perfect English, but those are my only complaints. I just ordered one for my brother's birthday present. Lots of fun! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: T. Soptick

customer_reviews.title: but it is holding up pretty well. For the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this cheap during a prime deal. I was suspicious of its durability at first, but it is holding up pretty well. For the price, its a great little toy. The Gyro doesn't work the best and my biggest complaint is the IR remote. It frequently losing connection and falls to the ground. If you are looking for a cheap toy to play with or teach the kids how to fly, this is a great product for the cost, but before of these shortcomings.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Best $20 toy known to man!
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun. Really well made for the price. Far exceeded my expectation. Everyone in the family from age 6 to 48 loves to fly this. I bought one, and then bought three more for the rest of the family. Note, not all 4 can fly and the same time due to limits of the radio.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

product_meta.title: Syma S107G 3 Channel RC Helicopter with Gyro, Blue
product_meta.description:
Color:BlueSyma S107G 3 Channel RC Helicopter with Gyro. Flight Control Includes Up/Down, Left/Right Turn, and Forward/Backward movements. Includes USB Charger, and Spare Tail Blade. For Use Indoors ONLY Due to Infrared Control. Volts: 3.7. Watt Hours: 0.56. Motor Type: Brushed. Age Rating: 14+ With Adult Supervision. Batteries: 15C 1S 150mAh 3.7V LiPO. Charger: USB. Radio: 3 Channel Infrared. Fuel Source: Electric. Length: 8.7 in (221mm). Height: 3.9 in (99.1mm). Width/Diameter: 7.5 in (190.5mm).

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Syma S107G 3.5 Channel RC Helicopter with Gyro in Blue color scheme. Flight Control Includes Up/Down, Left/Right Turn and Forward/Backward movements. Includes USB Charger and Spare Tail Blade. For Use Indoors ONLY Due to Infrared Control. Battery Type: Lithium Polymer (LiPO Battery). C Rate: 15C. Volts: 3.7. Capacity: 150mAh. Cell Count: 1S. Continuous Discharge: 15C (2.25A). Watt Hours: 0.56. Motor Type: Brushed. Age Rating: 14+ With Adult Supervision. Charger: USB. Radio: Infrared. Fuel Source: Electric. Length: 8.7 in (220.98mm). Height: 1.5 in (38.1mm). Width/Diameter: 3.9 in (99.06mm).
feature_bullets: S107 and S107G differ only in labeling. Either may be shipped.
Battery Type: Lithium Polymer (LiPO Battery), batteries for remote control not included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars15,713 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
